article:
In molecular biology and genetics, 'upstream' and 'downstream' both refer to a
relative position in DNA or RNA. Each strand of DNA or RNA has a 5' end and a 3'
end, so named for the carbons on the deoxyribose (or ribose) ring. Relative to
the position on the strand, downstream is the region towards the 3' end of the
strand. Since DNA strands run in opposite directions, downstream on one strand
is upstream on the other strand.
